channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How automakers are responding to the 25% car tariffs so far
item.description: It's only been a few days since President Trump's 25% tariffs on foreign cars took effect. But the import surcharge has led to some immediate changes,...

item.title: Photos: See demonstrators around the country rally in 'Hands Off!' protests
item.description: NPR member station photographers documented what they saw at the demonstrations against the Trump administration, from cuts and layoffs to federal dep...

item.title: Amadou Bagayoko, one half of Malian duo Amadou & Mariam, dies at 70
item.description: Bagayoko, an acclaimed guitarist and half of the Grammy-nominated blind duo Amadou & Mariam, died in his hometown of Bamako on Friday.

item.title: Nationwide 'Hands Off!' protests erupt against Trump and Musk
item.description: Demonstrations took place across the country, uniting a myriad of criticisms of the Trump administration under one message: "Hands off!"

item.title: Israel admits mistakes over medic killings in Gaza
item.description: Israeli forces shot dead 15 emergency workers in a convoy of ambulances near Rafah on 23 March.

item.title: The Hit-and-Run Homicide of Davis McClendon
item.description: A romance is cut short when a man is found dead near his mangled car. His newfound love is convinced it was no accident. "48 Hours" correspondent Anne...

item.title: India's rivers are home to 6,000 dolphins - but they are in trouble
item.description: Gangetic and Indus river dolphins are found in over two-dozen rivers in India.

item.title: No wigs please - the new rules shaking up beauty pageants
item.description: Wigs and beauty contests are big business in Ivory Coast, but the industry is facing change.

item.title: US cancels visas for South Sudanese over deportation dispute
item.description: The African nation is "taking advantage" of the US by not accepting its citizens, says the top US diplomat.

item.title: Houston pulls off furious rally to down Duke in Final Four
item.description: In an NCAA Tournament classic, Houston produced a stunning late-game comeback to defeat Duke 70-67 Saturday night.

item.title: "Hands Off!": Americans across country protest Trump, Musk
item.description: Hundreds of thousands took to the streets, in Washington, D.C. and other cities across the United States, in opposition to the policies of Donald Trum...

item.title: Florida edges Auburn in Final Four to advance to NCAA title game
item.description: The Gators will have the chance Monday night to win the SEC's first title since Kentucky in 2012.

item.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (April 6)
item.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the Emmy-winning program, hosted by Jane Pauley.

item.title: 'Oliver and Amanda Pig' series author Jean Van Leeuwen dies at 87
item.description: The children's book author best known for her Oliver and Amanda Pig series has died at 87. Van Leeuwen wrote nearly 60 books, some of which sold milli...

item.title: Angry protesters from New York to Alaska assail Trump and Musk in ‘Hands Off!’ rallies
Anti-Trump protests in cities across US declare 'hands off'
item.description: Thousands of protesters have gathered for the most visible opposition movement of Trump's second term.

item.title: At least 16 dead in flooding and tornadoes as storms slash from Texas to Ohio
item.description: Another round of torrential rain and flash flooding has come for parts of the South and Midwest already heavily waterlogged by days of severe storms t...

item.title: Trump goes all in with bet that the heavy price of tariffs will pay off for Americans
